content:
Hi :) I have a user reporting a really strange problem. He gets notification mails from our Zulip server because of new PMs. But then, he cannot find those PMs after logging in. Neither in the iOS-App, nor in the Mac-App, nor in the browser. It is as if the PM had never been written.
This issue appeared now for multiple times.
Please consider:

  • It's not that PMs generally do not work for this user. We communicated via PM and it worked fine.
  • The user is trustworthy, so he does not make fun of me.
  • The problematic messages all come from foreign first-time users (new students from different countries).
  • He did not mute those users.

Do you have any idea what could be going on?
Is it possible that the user has multiple accounts, and the PMs were sent to a different account than the one to which the user is logged in?

Oh yeah! He has indeed two accounts! That was the problem. Thank you so much, @Anders Kaseorg :thumbs_up:

This reminds me that I really need to bother @Tim Abbott again with the PR from @Felix (strifel) which would build the foundation for my PR to enhance the SAML authentication.
Because this is a really annoying problem for our users: Our university does not use the primary email address as persistent identifier. So people can easily change their primary email address. But if they forget to change it withing Zulip first, they always get a new account...
@Robert (ro-i) thanks for the reminder. I'm super super swamped right now but we should be able to find a time to integrate that this year.
